title: Bryce Canyon National Park: Operating Hours & Seasons
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Basic Information     Operating Hours & Seasons              Operating Hours & Seasons        Bryce Canyon Visitor Center and Bookstore. Photographed by Brian B. Roanhorse 24 April, 2016.      The park is open 24 hours per day throughout the year. There may be temporary road closures during and shortly after winter snow storms. Road(s) will stay closed until plowing is completed and conditions are safe for visitor traffic. Road maintenance may require brief closures of individual areas at other times.       Visitor Center Operating Hours     Summer May - September 8:00 a.m. - 8:00 p.m.   Fall October 8:00 a.m. - 6:00 p.m.   Winter November - March 8:00 a.m. - 4:30 p.m.   Spring April 8:00 a.m. - 6:00 p.m.       Help Desk Phone: (435)834-4747 Email: brca_information@nps.gov       Location 4.5 miles south of the intersection of Hwy. 12 & Hwy. 63 OR 1.5 miles inside Bryce Canyon National Park's northern boundary.  Closures 25 December, Christmas Day (Visitor Center and Fee Booths Only) Special Programs - Short informational Video shown on the half hour and on the hour at the Visitor Center. - Short Geology talks are usually held outside at Sunset Point. During inclement weather, Talks are held in the Visitor Center Museum or the Bryce Canyon Lodge auditorium. Exhibits Our new exhibit/museum is now open. We plan to have our grand opening August 25, 2016.  Available Facilities Restrooms, Bookstore, and a Ranger/VIP staffed Information Desk. Obtain Backcountry Permits at ranger help desk. Reminder Daylight Savings Time begins the second Sunday in March and ends the first Sunday in November. Bryce Canyon is in the Mountain Time Zone.
